name: Silmarillion Cheat Sheet
description: Valar and Maiar of Middle Earth

Lords of the Valar.val: Male; King of the Valar; god of wind and birds; ⚭ Varda, brother of Melkor (Morgoth)
Male; King of the Sea; associated with water, seas, and oceans; seclusive; No relationships
Male; The Great Smith; associated with earth, metals, and craftsmanship; creator of the dwarves; ⚭ Yavanna
Male; The Hunter; rides the great horse Nahar; terrible in anger; ⚭ Vána, brother of Nessa
Male; Doomsman of the Valar; master of fate and the Houses of the Dead (Mandos); knows almost all events, past and future; grim in countenance; ⚭ Vairë, brother of Irmo (Lórien) and Nienna
Male; Master of Visions and Dreams; along with Námo (Mandos) is one of the two Masters of Spirits (Fëanturi); ⚭ Estë, brother of Námo (Mandos) and Nienna
Male; The Strong; the most warlike Vala; fights with his bare hands; physically defeated Melkor (Morgoth) in the Years of the Trees; ⚭ Nessa
Male; Dark Lord; greatest of all the Valar; introduced evil into the world at its conception during the Music of the Ainur; brother of Manwë

Ladies of the Valar.val: Female; Queen of the Valar; Lady of the stars; most feared and hated by Melkor (Morgoth); alias Elbereth, Gilthoniel; ⚭ Manwë
Female; Giver of Fruits; created the flora and fauna of Middle Earth; created the Two Trees of Valinor; ⚭ Aulë, sister of Vána

Female; Lady of Pity and Mourning; teaches wisdom in greif and endurance in suffering; early influence of Gandalf; ever weeping for the harm done by evil in Middle Earth; sister of Námo (Mandos) and Irmo (Lórien)
Female; Healer of hurts and weariness; dwels with Irmo in Lórien; ⚭ Irmo (Lórien)
Female; Weaver of Time; weaves the story of the world into tapestries covering the halls of Mandos; ⚭ Námo (Mandos)
Female; The Ever-young; beautifull beyond compare;  flowers spring up where she steps; ⚭ Oromë, sister of Yavanna
Female; The Dancer; The Swift;  outruns the deer who follow her in the wild; ⚭ Tulkas, sister of Oromë

Lords of the Maiar.val: Male; Chief of the Maiar; Herald and Banner Bearer of Manwë
Male; Saruman the White; Istari (Wizard); Foremost wizard  and leader of the White Council; learned in lore and possesing a singular power of speech; divisive and duplicitous
Male; Gandolf the White; Istari (Wizard); Formerly Gandalf the Grey before the fall of Saruman the White;  played a pivotal role in the War of the Ring
Male; Radagast the Brown; Istari (Wizard); Former follower of Yavanna; shares her love of nature
Male; Istari (Wizard); one of the two blue wizards lost in the East of Middle Earth
Male; Istari (Wizard); one of the two blue wizards lost in the East of Middle Earth
Male; Vassal of Ulmo; controls coastal waters and inland seas;  formerly aligned with Melkor (Morgoth); his uneven temper results in stormy seas
Male; Vassal of Ulmo; made the Ulumúri for his master, the great conches which produce the music of the sea.
Female; Former follower of Oromë; Guided the Moon along its course; he was reckless, often failling to keep the Moon's appointed course, resulting in the moon being in the sky during the day
Male; Lord of the Rings; Most trusted servant and lieutenant of Melkor (Morgoth); vied for sole control of Middle Earth during the Second Age and Third Ages
Male; Lord of Balrogs; High-captain of Angband; captured Húrin, killed Fëanor, and died in the Fall of Gondolin

Ladies of the Maiar.val: Female; Chief of the Maiar; Handmaiden of Varda
Female; Queen of Doriath; mother of Lúthien
Female; Fire Spirit; guides the Sun along its course
Female; The Lady of the Sea; Wife of Ossë; guardian of all sea creatues and bringer of calm seas;  beloved by sailors
